title: That feeling when your support doesn't buy sightstone

replies.body:
**Simba has refunded {{item:2045}}  for {{item:3089}} **
http://cdn1.theodysseyonline.com/files/2015/07/16/635726746460269995663068653_tumblr_inline_nmt2b4bbxQ1ss3fs2_540.jpg
omfg! this made my day seriously
Ditto!! ROFLMAO xD.

I'm Leona! I need no sightstone! All I need is sunfire to win lane!

http://pm1.narvii.com/5792/f0d9980cae1095e387ce7edb7f9e620da5c2e1fa_hq.jpg
{{champion:89}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3036}} {{item:1301}}  Come. Let's win a match...

{{champion:40}} {{item:2045}}  {{item:3069}} {{item:3056}}  {{item:3512}} {{item:3060}} {{item:3222}} {{item:3363}} 
Wouldn't it be a shame if you never got close enough to use those items?

Oh, and by the way. I'm about to take 2 of your turrets. Better go do some wave clear while we take this one. ;p

*P.S.:* I need more item slots.
. . . And hot kys.
sightstone so useless, i'd rather have an extra tank item. trinket is fine
sightstone is a tank item

Tank items must have BOTH HP and either armor or resistance, otherwise they are just hp items/bruiser items.

(Just my opinion.)

... exceptions exist? With the highest HP on an item, and a powerful regen passive, you could...

Whatever, it's a tank item! D:

Edit: Well shit, I forgot {{item:3800}} was a thing. Now I feel stupid.
Aaaand you can also combine sightstone with support items.

I wouldn't call sightstone alone a tank item, since 150 hp isn't anything special... but then again, not every incomplete item can be classified (like catalyst building into a tank and a mage item).

But ruby sightstone could be called a support tank item, I guess. It has the same HP as Righteous Glory, and instead of defenses they both have utility stats.
{{item:2303}} Was talking about this item lol. You make it from sightstone. Gives decent support/tank stats.

Oh, you must have edited it :V

Yeah, that item is *godly.* If only it was viable (enough) for people to buy it in non-support roles, with the removal of green wards... although the occasional tank jungler could get away with it...

No edit, my original comment has always been combining sightstone with support item, that's what you do to make the one I posted.

>Yeah, that item is godly. If only it was viable (enough) for people to buy it in non-support roles

I thought we were talking about supports? Zeke's is a pretty good item, yet I don't see non-supports buying it. Devourer is a pretty good item, yet I don't see non-junglers buying it. so what's exactly the point here lol. Mine is that you can get a tank/support item and NOT give up helping your team.
Perfect for certain. . . .tarics/sejuanis, not so much for Leonas.

The hell is this.

Last season my 100 game leona had 72% win rate.

Let me tell you a story.

{{item:3401}} {{item:1321}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3512}} 

And you will never lose.
Your 72% win rate says otherwise. You lose 28% of the time, some of which could be prevented by having vision :P

If that's true. then this build ought to get about 75% winrate.

{{item:2303}} {{item:1321}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3512}} and then you just get 10% CDR from runes to make up for the difference.

Wait, that's my Taric support build. That can't be right...
Voidlings give vision around themselves. So it can't be because of not enough vision.

http://i.imgur.com/MWdlDy3.jpg

{{item:3512}} 
- 1 spot
- voidling travel vision (limited)
- 2.5 minute cooldown
- lasts until destroyed or replaced

vs.

{{item:2049}} {{item:2045}} {{item:2303}} {{item:2302}} {{item:2301}} 
- up to 3 spots
- larger vision radius
- wards are stealthed so enemies are usually unaware that you know where they are
- vision lasts up to 2.5 minutes
- charges refill by going to the fountain
- can buy with zz'rot and still be effective *gasp*

_only comparing vision control stats of the items, not the raw stats or ability to control minion waves_

To make it utterly and absolutely clear, I was joking.

Remember! This is Memes&Games! If we aren't joking in here something is wrong.
(phew) Okay good. I was worried there for a second xD
Because zz rot portal existed last season. Right?  :))
It did....
I get it on Sion.

Same c:
Welp, I could just stalk you and react to every Sion comment you make ^_^
https://imgflip.com/readImage?iid=28394548
Nothing weird about that
{{summoner:31}}

Well if you're going to, I might as well send you the first Sion comment I made.
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/MygVPEZ3-the-vow-of-sion-story

Which is sadly the only piece I've written on those boards that was well received, making me feel like a 1-hit wonder.
Ah yes, I remember this. 'twas a great read back in the day.
3D modeling you say?  Interesting.

It's a school assignment :P
I'm in my first year on this school, so it's the ''Test everything out'' year.
Right now, I'm spending 4 weeks learning some 3d modelling, this  is the 3th week.
I'm really enjoying it, so I hope I'll be allowed to study 'Game Art' next year ^-^
{{summoner:31}}

>  this is the **3th** week.

_Incredibly cringing..._
Sion is another exception; You get more armor/MR items over HP due to his "infinite hp".

> [{quoted}](name=Tysmin,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=iJ0m4tsY,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-04-04T01:37:27.924+0000)
>
> sightstone is a tank item

A bad one.
Its active is the highest value active in the game. It just takes skill to use properly.

> [{quoted}](name=sixdogman,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=iJ0m4tsY,comment-id=0002000000010000,timestamp=2016-04-04T16:42:53.994+0000)
>
> Its active is the highest value active in the game. It just takes skill to use properly.

Thats a stretch lol
not even close, name one that is stronger.
That feeling when you have 3 wards down and a pink and they are the only ones on the map........
That feeling when you pink dragon and your jungler and your mid walk right on by...
what is so wrong with vision?? No one takes it seriously.
Vision wins games...well actually, taking objectives wins games but vision helps make it possible!

it depends on the rank.

in bronze and silver warding isn't very important since most people won't look at minimap, so you're basicaly warding for yourself. gold upwards, on the other hand, it's pretty much mandatory

Nah. gold=silver=bronze. plat is true promise land.

edit: vision only, not team-play/mechanics
thanks for the correction :)
In my elo (Silver), half the supports don't buy {{item:2049}}. That's why I have to go support myself.
